Jayde sees her fellows quite literally drop in on Spike and Talon - 
before she drops herself, falling into stasis lock.

Devilcat swings toward Talon, his force shield deflecting the 
dragon's shots away harmlessly.  "You will learn what it means to 
challenge the mightiest of the Rogues!" he snarls as he pulls up to 
unleash the power of his subspace cannon.  A spatial ripple streaks 
out from his chest towards its intended target.  (The subspace cannon 
is pretty much an impact-based weapon - if it connects, it knocks you 
flying.  Of course, if it DOESN'T hit Talon, it's going to blast a 
very large hole in the ground.)

Riekan's attack is much more direct, dodging to one side so that 
Spike's ammo grazes his flank instead of swiss-cheesing his face.  He 
launches an explosive harpoon, with one of his fin-like boomerang 
blades following close behind.  (Whether he realizes it or not, 
Spike's going to have to deal with the latter coming AND going.)

Torin doesn't attack at all, instead landing to check on his wounded 
comrade.

OOC: Ah, yes, the eternal paradox of the Rogues: ruthless and 
compassionate at the same time.  I expect this will befuddle a number 
of characters as they try to pin some identifying mark on the 
standard Rogue persona.

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "deltazero1" <DeltaZero1@h...> wrote:
> Spike rolled behind a large rock and transformed to robot mode and 
> started to shot at the others that appeared out of nowhere using 
the 
> rock as a shield
> 
> "well ss i suggest u get them out of here, we can't risk the slim 
> chance they get captured" talon said running towards spike firing 
ice 
> lasers trying to make a few ice transformers on a stick
